intro: Microlicia fasciculata var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved microlicia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom during the wet season, attracting various pollinators. The varietal name 'parvifolia' refers to its smaller leaves compared to the typical form of the species.
